Issues.Title: Docs: call out CanDeactivate breaking change in v15 update guide
Issues.Body:
### Describe the problem that you experienced

The 4th parameter (`nextState`) of CanDeactivate is optional in v14 and required in v15, this is a breaking change and should be called out in the Angular Update Guide.

https://v14.angular.io/api/router/CanDeactivate
https://v15.angular.io/api/router/CanDeactivate

Issues.Title: CI: prevent injection attacks on benchmark-compare.yml workflow
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [x] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Currently the benchmark-compare.yml workflow was successible to injection attacks on its [line 47](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/.github/workflows/benchmark-compare.yml#L47), as user input is being used directly on executable code. This pattern was identified using Scorecard, and you can find more details about the involved risks at [this GitHub Documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/actions/security-guides/security-hardening-for-github-actions#understanding-the-risk-of-script-injections).

Issue Number: N/A

## What is the new behavior?
Now the user input will be treated as an environment variable, which doesn't interact with the script generation process. This change would prevent any injection attacks.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

## Other information

I'm Diogo and I work on Google's Open Source Security Team([GOSST](https://github.com/diogoteles08#about-gosst-ghost)) in cooperation with the Open Source Security Foundation ([OpenSSF](https://openssf.org/)). My core job is to suggest and implement security changes on widely used open source projects ðŸ˜Š

Issues.Title: refactor(compiler-cli): add internal compiler option to control NgModule selector scope emit
Issues.Body: An internal compiler option named `supportJitMode` is now available for use by the Angular CLI. This option currently controls the emit of NgModule selector scope information. This emitted information is only needed in AOT mode when an application also uses JIT. However, AOT mode combined with JIT mode is not currently supported nor will work in the Angular CLI. With the Angular CLI, JIT mode is only supported if the entire application is built in JIT mode. Without this option, the CLI needs to manually perform a code transform to remove the information and also replicate TypeScript's import eliding. This is can be a complicated operation and must be continually kept up to date with any changes to both the Angular compiler and TypeScript. The introduction of this new option alleviates these concerns while also removing several build time actions that would otherwise need to be performed on every application build.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(compiler-cli): add internal compiler option to control NgModule selector scope emit" (#51007)

Issues.Title: i18n - option to remove line numbers from xlf2 location notes
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

`extract-i18n` with `xlf2` format produces an xlf file with notes about the location of the text, e.g.

`<note category="location">my-component.html:133</note>`

When we sync this to language files, this carries over. The location of the text doesn't seem to effect its ID, so if some text simply moves to a different line number, we don't need to do anything (we have errors enabled for missing localisations, so if something changes  in such a way that a new ID is generated, we would have to adjust the language files to handle that).

However, a change in line number _does_ increase the chance of merge conflicts in a file that is frequently modified among many teams and developers. I believe the locations are there to add more context for a translator when doing translations, however, we feel the file without a line number, in combination with notes about the description and meaning, would be sufficient for giving context.


### Proposed solution

Add an option that controls whether line numbers are included in location notes.

### Alternatives considered

We have considered creating a script to remove the location notes from the language files. Assume Angular would still be able to match up localisations with those notes missing, using the ID. However, this is an extra step for us, and if the base file didn't have them it would simplify our syncing process.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "i18n - option to remove line numbers from xlf2 location notes" (#51028)

Issues.Title: Inputs on Child Components given as method calls inside templates break in production
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core, elements

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

First of all, sorry if the explanation will not be exactly technical. I will try to explain as best I can what is happening and where the breaking points may be so that you may investigate further.

Context: There are two components: **ParentComponent**, with irrelevant content, containing a **NestedDropdownComponent** which receives as input a list of _Items_ from the **ParentComponent**.

**ParentComponent** gets a list of _fields_ from the backend, but for the **NestedDropdownComponent** to work, these _fields_ need to be mapped to _items_, which is done through an injected mapper service, called simply **MapperService**.

There are two ways this can be done:

`1)`
**ParentComponent.ts**

`ngOnInit() {`
`this.fields$ = getFieldsAsObservable();`
`this.fields$.subscribe(fields => this.items = mapperService.map(fields));`
`}`

**ParentComponent.html**

`<tk-nested-dropdown [items] = "items"> </tk-nested-dropdown>`

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

`2)`
**ParentComponent.ts**

`ngOnInit() {`
`this.fields$ = getFieldsAsObservable();`
`}`

**ParentComponent.html**

`<ng-container *ngIf="fields$ | async; let fields">`
`<tk-nested-dropdown [items] = "mapperService.map(fields)"> </tk-nested-dropdown>`
`</ng-container>`

**In dev environment** (ng served), both implementations work as intended with no issues whatsoever. 

**In prod environment** (ng build), implementation `2)` stops working. When trying to select an item from the `NestedDropdownComponent`, the item is not selectable.

From my investigation, the click event does not register on the element upon inspection, however on click the focus jumps on a "child" element simply named comment. 

**Before click**
![image](https://github.com/angular/angular/assets/139352684/0bc47fe3-f231-4103-9fc4-10290246094f)

**After click**
![image](https://github.com/angular/angular/assets/139352684/682c8630-1b9e-4d04-894d-fa749978d816)



### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 15.0.3
Node: 18.12.1
Package Manager: npm 8.19.2
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 15.0.3
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... localize, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
```


### Anything else?

_No response_

Issues.Title: fix(compiler): safe implementation of transform function call added to tackle runtime error if the function is null
Issues.Body:
The new code wraps the function call within a safeTernaryWithTemporary call. This means that before calling the function, a check is performed to see if the function is null or undefined. If it is, the expression evaluates to null without calling the function (avoiding a potential error). If the function exists, it is called with the provided arguments.

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [x] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->
The original code transforms this safe function call into a regular function call (o.InvokeFunctionExpr). This means that if the function does not exist, it will try to invoke it anyway, which would result in a runtime error. So, the "safe" aspect of the function call (i.e., not throwing an error if the function does not exist) was not respected in the original code.


## What is the new behavior?

The replacement code respects this "safe" aspect by wrapping the function call in a ternary expression that first checks if the function exists before trying to call it. If the function does not exist, it returns null without attempting to call the function, thereby preventing a possible runtime error.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(compiler): safe implementation of transform function call added to tackle runtime error if the function is null" (#51015)

Issues.Title: Force Universal to wait for component promises to resolve before rendering.
Issues.Body:
# ðŸš€ Feature request

#### What modules are relevant for this feature request?

<!-- âœï¸edit: -->

- [ ] builders
- [X] common
- [X] express-engine

### Description

I have an angular universal instance that requires data from a CMS (prismic) to render the majority of the page, (theme data, menu systems, etc). I use the CMS's SDK to make all requests, as you might expect when working with a third-party software vendor. So this request does not use the angular HTTP client. In some instances, what I've noticed is that sporadically universal will have either waited for this request or skipped it entirely in the rendered HTML.

Is there a way to mark specific Promises/HTTP requests as required for the page to bootstrap correctly? As I understand wrapping a third-party libraries request in a macrotask is no longer an option. 

### Describe the solution you'd like

Documentation around this topic / Some method of wrapping such an essential promise from a third-party library that will force Universal to wait for the result of the HTTP request before rendering its HTML.

### Ideal Solution

Potentially some lifecycle hook or other service that allows me to say, "When you've hit this point you're allowed to respond to the request with what you have"

### What have I tried so far

I've tried, moving it between the service and the bootstrapping component, loading with observables, promises and anything that comes to mind.

Half a solution to my problem would be chucking the theme object into some KV and passing it in through the provider's section of the bootstrapping process, but that does not help requests that are requesting things like "page content"

The only other solution I can think of would be to implement some KV cache that any request by this library (prismicio/client) would have to check before completing, lowering the frequency of this issue occurring but not resolving it.

I have also tried implementing and tinkering with this snippet here. however, my issue is still occurring.  https://gist.github.com/sparebytes/e2bc438e3cfca7f6687f1d61287f8d72

Issues.Body: The esbuild plugin used within the esbuild-based browser application builder will now use the newly introduced internal `supportJitMode` AOT compiler option to disable the emit of NgModule scope metadata functions within the output code. This removes the need to perform an additional transformation of the AOT compiler generated code to immediately remove the metadata. The Angular CLI neither previously nor currently supports hybrid AOT/JIT mode. In the future if this support situation changes, additional behavior may be added control the internal `supportJitMode` option.

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>evanw/esbuild (esbuild)</summary>

### [`v0.18.12`](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#01812)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/compare/v0.18.11...v0.18.12)

-   Fix a panic with `const enum` inside parentheses ([#​3205](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/3205))

    This release fixes an edge case where esbuild could potentially panic if a TypeScript `const enum` statement was used inside of a parenthesized expression and was followed by certain other scope-related statements. Here's a minimal example that triggers this edge case:

    ```ts
    (() => {
      const enum E { a };
      () => E.a
    })
    ```

-   Allow a newline in the middle of TypeScript `export type` statement ([#​3225](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/3225))

    Previously esbuild incorrectly rejected the following valid TypeScript code:

    ```ts
    export type
    { T };

    export type
    * as foo from 'bar';
    ```

    Code that uses a newline after `export type` is now allowed starting with this release.

-   Fix cross-module inlining of string enums ([#​3210](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/3210))

    A refactoring typo in version 0.18.9 accidentally introduced a regression with cross-module inlining of string enums when combined with computed property accesses. This regression has been fixed.

-   Rewrite `.js` to `.ts` inside packages with `exports` ([#​3201](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/3201))

    Packages with the `exports` field are supposed to disable node's path resolution behavior that allows you to import a file with a different extension than the one in the source code (for example, importing `foo/bar` to get `foo/bar.js`). And TypeScript has behavior where you can import a non-existent `.js` file and you will get the `.ts` file instead. Previously the presence of the `exports` field caused esbuild to disable all extension manipulation stuff which included both node's implicit file extension searching and TypeScript's file extension swapping. However, TypeScript appears to always apply file extension swapping even in this case. So with this release, esbuild will now rewrite `.js` to `.ts` even inside packages with `exports`.

-   Fix a redirect edge case in esbuild's development server ([#​3208](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/3208))

    The development server canonicalizes directory URLs by adding a trailing slash. For example, visiting `/about` redirects to `/about/` if `/about/index.html` would be served. However, if the requested path begins with two slashes, then the redirect incorrectly turned into a protocol-relative URL. For example, visiting `//about` redirected to `//about/` which the browser turns into `http://about/`. This release fixes the bug by canonicalizing the URL path when doing this redirect.

</details>

<details>
<summary>postcss/postcss (postcss)</summary>

Issues.Title: Angular application will not run after upgrade to angular 16.
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

After upgrading my angular 14 application to angular 16, the application will not longer run after building. The application runs in development mode just fine so I did not think it would be a problem after building.  I first tried building and deploying the application via the build server and it will not run. Then I tried building manually from vscode terminal and deploying the app manually and still does not run. The main.js blows up with uncaught reference error where a variable (different variable name each build) is not defined. Of course the code is obfuscated so hard to see what it is trying to do at this point.   See uploaded images..

![Angular 16 error](https://github.com/angular/angular/assets/10948856/054d5796-7331-4626-8bea-4be68569e60c)
![Angular 16 error_2](https://github.com/angular/angular/assets/10948856/5756cb01-2d0c-4d30-9278-aa77a95001ce)


### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://test.tropicos.org

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
the error is due to an undefined variable in the main.js generated file. here is the command used on the build server to build
node --max_old_space_size=8192 ./node_modules/@angular/cli/bin/ng build --aot=true --base-href="/" --configuration=production --output-path="$(Build.BinariesDirectory)\dist

for my manual test I used 
ng build --aot=true --base-href="/" --configuration="qa"
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 16.1.4
Node: 16.18.0
Package Manager: npm 8.19.2
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 16.1.4
... animations, cdk, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core
... forms, language-service, localize, material
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1601.4
@angular-devkit/build-angular   16.1.4
@angular-devkit/core            16.1.4
@angular-devkit/schematics      16.1.4
@angular/flex-layout            15.0.0-beta.42
@schematics/angular             16.1.4
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.1.6
```


### Anything else?

This is a very large project that was started in Angular 2 5 years ago and now is up to angular 14 (upgrading over the years) and trying to get to 16. It literally took 3 days of package upgrades to get to this point from 14 to 16 so I would like to try to figure out what is going on. I can provide more information and or files if needed but would like any help I can get to try to figure out why this is no longer working when built v.s. running in development server.

The application is served up in IIS on a Windows server. Nothing has changed and this is the first time having this problem. 
Thanks in advance for your help.

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): inject Sass import/use directive importer information when resolving
Issues.Body: To correctly resolve a package based import reference in a Sass file with pnpm or Yarn PnP, the importer file path must be known. Unfortunately, the Sass compiler does not provided the importer file to import plugins. Previously to workaround this issue, all previously resolved stylesheets were tried as the importer path. This allowed the stylesheets to be resolved but it also could cause a potentially large increase in build time due to the amount of previous stylesheets that would need to be tried. To avoid the performance impact and to also provide more accurate information regarding the importer file, a lexer is now used to extract import information for a stylesheet and inject the importer file path into the specifier. This information is then extracted from the import specifier during the Sass resolution process and allows the underlying package resolution access to a viable location to resolve the package for all package managers. This information is currently limited to specifiers referencing the `@angular` and `@material` package scopes but a comprehensive pre-resolution process may be added in the future.

Issues.Title: @angular-devkit/build-angular:server with optimization: true fails in 16.1.4. 16.1.1 works well
Issues.Body:
### Command

run

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

16.1.1

### Description

Exception appears on run main.js with node 16 after build with optimization using @angular-devkit/build-angular@16.1.4 with @angular-devkit/build-angular@16.1.1 works well

### Minimal Reproduction

1 buid the project: ng build --configuration=production && ng run app:server:production 
Works correctly
2 Run the main.js present exception
node dist/app/server/main.js

```
TypeError: Right-hand side of 'instanceof' is not an object
    at insertElement (/Users/juanmaldonado/dev/ekilu-web-16/dist/app/server/main.js:1:490276)
    at insertHTMLElement (/Users/juanmaldonado/dev/ekilu-web-16/dist/app/server/main.js:1:489998)
    at before_head_mode (/Users/juanmaldonado/dev/ekilu-web-16/dist/app/server/main.js:1:527950)
    at HTMLParser.htmlparser.insertToken (/Users/juanmaldonado/dev/ekilu-web-16/dist/app/server/main.js:1:489022)
    at emitSimpleTag (/Users/juanmaldonado/dev/ekilu-web-16/dist/app/server/main.js:1:494203)
    at data_state (/Users/juanmaldonado/dev/ekilu-web-16/dist/app/server/main.js:1:494241)
    at scanChars (/Users/juanmaldonado/dev/ekilu-web-16/dist/app/server/main.js:1:485784)
    at Object.parse (/Users/juanmaldonado/dev/ekilu-web-16/dist/app/server/main.js:1:483851)
    at Object.exports2.createDocument (/Users/juanmaldonado/dev/ekilu-web-16/dist/app/server/main.js:1:721803)
    at Object.exports2.createWindow (/Users/juanmaldonado/dev/ekilu-web-16/dist/app/server/main.js:1:722306)
```

The problem disappears if in angular.json
optimization is set to false --> Not a real fix
or if downgrade to  "@angular-devkit/build-angular": "^16.1.1",


Final configuration:
`Angular CLI: 16.1.4
Node: 16.20.0
Package Manager: npm 8.19.4
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 16.1.4
... animations, cdk, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core
... forms, language-service, localize, material
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, platform-server
... router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------

@angular-devkit/core            16.1.4
@angular-devkit/schematics      16.1.4
@nguniversal/builders           16.1.1
@nguniversal/express-engine     16.1.1
@schematics/angular             16.1.4
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.1.6`


### Exception or Error

```text
TypeError: Right-hand side of 'instanceof' is not an object
    at insertElement (/Users/juanmaldonado/dev/ekilu-web-16/dist/app/server/main.js:1:490276)
    at insertHTMLElement (/Users/juanmaldonado/dev/ekilu-web-16/dist/app/server/main.js:1:489998)
    at before_head_mode (/Users/juanmaldonado/dev/ekilu-web-16/dist/app/server/main.js:1:527950)
    at HTMLParser.htmlparser.insertToken (/Users/juanmaldonado/dev/ekilu-web-16/dist/app/server/main.js:1:489022)
    at emitSimpleTag (/Users/juanmaldonado/dev/ekilu-web-16/dist/app/server/main.js:1:494203)
```

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add support for serving SSR with dev-server when using the application builder
Issues.Body: This commit introduces experimental support for serving the application in SSR mode with the Vite based dev-server when using the application builder.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add support for serving SSR with dev-server when using the application builder" (#25517)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): ensure TS resolution cache with file replacements
Issues.Body: When overriding module resolution on a TypeScript Host object, TypeScript will not automatically create a resolution cache for the Host. Within the application build system the TypeScript resolution is only overrided if file replacements are used. A resolution cache is now manually created and added to the TypeScript Host when file replacements are present.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): ensure TS resolution cache with file replacements" (#25520)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: update dependency @typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin to v6" (#25522)

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): only load browserslist in babel preset if needed
Issues.Body: The `browserslist` package is only needed in the custom Babel application preset if the `supportedBrowsers` option is specified. This option is not used within the esbuild-based browser application builder. The `browserslist` is now lazily imported only when needed and avoids the overhead of loading browser support data when not needed by the build.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): only load browserslist in babel preset if needed" (#25519)

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): filter postcss usage based on content in esbuild builder
Issues.Body: When using the esbuild-based browser application builder, stylesheets that do not need any postcss processing will now skip the postcss step of the stylesheet build pipeline. Currently, only Tailwind CSS leverages postcss and Tailwind CSS is an opt-in feature. As a result, postcss will only be used if Tailwind CSS is configured for the project and a stylesheet contains one or more of the directives/functions specific to Tailwind as provided by https://tailwindcss.com/docs/functions-and-directives. This change should be most beneficial for component stylesheets which will rarely contain Tailwind specific rules that need additional processing.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): filter postcss usage based on content in esbuild builder" (#25518)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): Set chunk names explicitly
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist

Please check to confirm your PR fulfills the following requirements:

<!-- Please check all that apply using "x". -->

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#-commit-message-guidelines
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

## PR Type

What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:

## What is the current behavior?

<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Currently, chunk names are determined by ESBuild. Some libraries may resolve to a name that is not in a format of `chunk.hash.mjs`. This causes Jest to run over the lib files and fail as it contains no test suite.

Fixes: #25189

## What is the new behavior?

The change sets chunk name pattern explicitly so that all `chunk`s are exluded by pattern from running tests over.

<!-- Please describe the new behavior that. -->

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->

## Other information

I didn't figure out how this could be covered by tests. I did run a local build & installation and verified on a sample project that `@azure/msal-angular` no longer creates a "StandardController" file. Instead, it's named as `chunk...` and hence is excluded from tests.

Issues.Title: bug(MatFormFieldModule): Resize not working when using in standalone
Issues.Body:
### Description

I spent lots of hours trying to find why I'm unable to resize my `mat-form-fields` and then found out that it is only not working beacuse we are using standalone components instead of NgModule.


### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
I used the example from the official docs (v14, https://v14.material.angular.io/components/form-field/overview#form-field-theming) to reproduce this in Stackblitz:

1. This is a working example: https://stackblitz.com/edit/pghvre-qtk1t6?file=src%2Fapp%2Fform-field-theming-example.html
2. This is the link with the same example, but as standalone component: https://stackblitz.com/edit/pghvre-sczu3y?file=src%2Fmain.ts


### Expected Behavior

No matter if I use `standalone: true` or an `NgModule` based setup the result should be the same. The padding that is applied to the form field should shrink like it does when using it with `NgModule`.


### Actual Behavior

In the standalone version, different classes are generated which don't render the correct resizing:
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/2816893/29696e84-00f6-4a5a-9c11-3697d143d718)

For comparison, this is what the element looks like if `NgModule` is used:
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/2816893/750c0e68-bced-4339-9459-cfecb414fbb2)



### Environment

- Angular: 16.1.4
- CDK/Material: 16.1.4
- Browser(s): Chrome and Firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 11
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatFormFieldModule): Resize not working when using in standalone" (#27452)

Issues.Title: feat(MatDialog): Implement hide/show methods
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

This feature was previously discussed on #5162.

The proposed solution was to use the addPanelClass method to hide the dialog. But it doesn't work if you are using a backdrop. I built a [demo](https://stackblitz.com/edit/hide-md-dialog-with-backdrop?file=src%2Ftest%2Ftest.component.ts) to show the problem ([TestDialog01Component](https://stackblitz.com/edit/hide-md-dialog-with-backdrop?file=src%2Ftest-dialog-01%2Ftest-dialog-01.component.ts)).  There is no way to get the current overlay of the dialog to dispose of it manually  (See #15840).

I could find a workaround ([TestDialog02Component](https://stackblitz.com/edit/hide-md-dialog-with-backdrop?file=src%2Ftest-dialog-02%2Ftest-dialog-02.component.ts)) by not using the built-in backdrop and creating a custom overlay. But it feels too hacky.

The MdDIalog should have a built-in hide/show method or expose the overlayRef. 

If the team accepts it, I could implement it and send a PR.

### Use Case

I think in at least two use cases:

- An expensive operation to render the dialog.
- Using [Optimistic UI](https://uxplanet.org/optimistic-1000-34d9eefe4c05) to hide the modal as soon as the user clicks the button, but it needs to run some async operations that depend on each other, so you cannot destroy the modal until all the operations are complete (my use case).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "feat(MatDialog): Implement hide/show methods" (#27448)

Issues.Title: bug(Slider): Rounded thumb label text value, inconsistent with actual value
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14.2.7

### Description

Rounded thumb label text value, inconsistent with actual value.

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: Not needed. Can be reproduced on the Material demo page for Slider.
Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to: https://v15.material.angular.io/components/slider/examples#slider-configurable (can also be reproduced on v16.1.4)
2. Enable the "Show thumb label" checkbox
3. Write the value: 12.5
4. Write the step size value: 1
There's already an inconsistency, the value stored is 12.5 but the thumb label says 13.
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/17402311/2db14fdb-e506-479f-9229-23a1eb8679b6)

5. Write the step size value: 0.5
The thumb label is still rounded. 
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/17402311/daf5dc90-b861-42cd-88d2-3a53322b5689)




### Expected Behavior

For the value 12.5 with the step value 0.5, I expect the thumb label to be 12.5.

When changing the step size, I expect that the thumb label is also updated accordingly.
The thumb label updates accordingly only after changing the slider value.

### Actual Behavior

For the value 12.5 with the step value 0.5, the thumb label shows the value 13.

Changing the step size doesn't update the thumb label text accordingly.



### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.9
- CDK/Material: 15.2.9
- Browser(s): Tested with Chrome, but I think all of them
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(Slider): Rounded thumb label text value, inconsistent with actual value" (#27445)

Issues.Title: feat(MatStepper): Ability to focus the current step header
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

I would like to be able to programmatically set focus to the current step header.

### Use Case

There are 2 use cases where I would like to be able to programmatically set focus to a step header:

1. When initially loading a page, I want to be able to give focus to the current step header.
2. When switching between steps programmatically using `MatStepper.next`, if anything has been done that caused the focus to shift outside of the stepper, the intended behavior of focusing the newly-selected header does not happen. I need to be able to move the focus back to the current step header.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(MatStepper): Ability to focus the current step header" (#27450)

Issues.Title: build: improve dev app appearance toggles
Issues.Body:
Currently we have some toggles to change the appearance of the dev app (e.g. changing the theme, updating the direction). It has a few problems:
1. We have a lot of toggles so we're starting to run out of space in the toolbar.
2. The state of some of the toggles is saved in `localStorage` while for others it isn't.
3. The code is a bit messy since we were adding these toggles ad-hoc.

These changes address the issues by:
1. Switching all the buttons to icons which take up less space.
2. Having a centralized way to save the state to `localStorage` so we don't need to do it on a case-by-case basis.
3. Cleaning up the logic a bit.

I've also added a dedicated button for toggling the tokens theming API, because currently it's done through a query parameter which isn't easy to discover.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: improve dev app appearance toggles" (#27446)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(Guide): Define a typography level
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

The documentation states that I can customize the font size via:

```
@use '@angular/material' as mat;

$my-custom-level: mat.define-typography-level(
  $font-family: Roboto,
  $font-weight: 400,
  $font-size: 1rem,
  $line-height: 1,
  $letter-spacing: normal,
);
```

How can I actually make use of `$my-custom-level`? It seems that this part is missing in the documentation.

### Affected documentation page

https://material.angular.io/guide/typography#define-a-level
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(Guide): Define a typography level" (#27449)

Issues.Title: bug(MatTab): matieral tab header: pagination controls flickering
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

15

### Description

At some particular widths, the tab header will jump between two states:
- display the tab headers with pagination control (ie < on far left and > on far right)
- display the tab headers without pagination controls

I cannot make a sample code to show this, but it has already appeared on two of my pages. When it happens, the page width is wide enough to show all the tab headers without scrolling. Yet, the <> appears (making the headers to be displayed with less spacing) and then disappears. It is happening at more times per second than my eye can catch. All I can see is a pair of blur images for each tab header, since they are placed at slightly different locations with vs without the <>. On inspection, the class `mat-mdc-tab-header-pagination-controls-enabled` will be applied and removed from the mat-tab-header at top speed.

This is the same as the [locked issue 27084](https://github.com/angular/components/issues/27084)

@amysorto 

### Reproduction

I have no idea how to reproduce it, it happens when the material tab group has a particular range of width.

Even given a page with a material tab group, it is not always possible to resize the page to make this happen.

[Refer to the photo I took](https://photos.app.goo.gl/n8BDCaRZsSqsaLjJ6)



### Expected Behavior

the tab headers should either be displayed with or without the scrolling controls < and >

### Actual Behavior

the display is swapping between the two, making the headers unreadable.

### Environment

- Angular: 16.1.4
- CDK/Material: 16.1.4
- Browser(s): Chrome Version 114.0.5735.199 (Official Build) (64-bit)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10 21H2
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatTab): matieral tab header: pagination controls flickering" (#27443)

Issues.Title: Angular Material DatePicker: Allow option to show two months in the date picker
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

This feature was requested 5 years ago so I figured it would be worth asking if circumstances have changed to be able to have the option to show two months in the date picker as requested earlier in this issue [Git Hub Issue 14586](https://github.com/angular/components/issues/14586).

![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/113653924/440ce3c4-2ad6-4a76-8664-c25115da8ccb)

I think the original requestor has provided a pretty decent description of the feature.

A couple of suggestions would be

a) It would be available both in single date picker and date range picker.
b) It would be an opt-in setting, which by default would be off so it's backward compatible.
 ` <mat-datepicker [multimonth]="true #picker></mat-datepicker>`
   
and

`<mat-date-range-picker [multimonth]="true #picker #picker></mat-date-range-picker>`


But if feedback is needed I'd be happy to provide more details.


### Use Case

Most users now prefer a two month date picker which there are other options to choose from, but we've invested into the material components so it'd be nice if this was available natively.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular Material DatePicker: Allow option to show two months in the date picker" (#27441)

Issues.Title: bug(MatAutocompleteModule): Unable to navigate between autocomplete input and overlay options panel using iOS VoiceOver
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Using IOS VoiceOver, using gesture to cycle between form controls, skips the overlay panel and thus preventing user from selecting a valid option.

The issue can be reproduced using  [Autocomplete example from Material components page ](https://material.angular.io/components/autocomplete/examples)


 



### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/pqfm6j
Steps to reproduce:
1. Access the page using IOS device (iPhone)
2. Enable VoiceOver 
3. Using gesture swipe navigate to the autoccomplete field
4. `double tap` to edit "number" field
5.  Swipe to search for letter "O" (as in Oscar)
6. `double tap` to accept selection "O"
7. Now two options are displayed on screen "One" , "Two"
8. use `Swipe Right` gesture to cycle between values


### Expected Behavior

Expected behaviour is, when dropdown with selectable values appear, user should be able to cycle through options using swipe gesture 

### Actual Behavior

Actual Behaviour is :
The focus skips the available options displayed and focuses on next form field, leaving the Autocomplete field

### Environment

- Angular:  16.1.1
- CDK/Material: 16.1.4
- Browser(s): Safari, Google Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): iOS 15, iOS16
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatAutocompleteModule): Unable to navigate between autocomplete input and overlay options panel using iOS VoiceOver  " (#27442)

Issues.Title: fix(material/expansion): panel content visible when placed inside a hidden parent
Issues.Body:
The expansion panel was setting `visibility: visible` on the content which meant that it would be visible when placed inside of a parent that is `visibility: hidden`.

These changes resolve the issue by clear the `visibility` instead.

Fixes #27436.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/expansion): panel content visible when placed inside a hidden parent" (#27438)

Issues.Title: bug(MatTabGroup): Visibility hidden mat-active-tab is not removed when MatTabGroup and MatTabs are used inside MatMenu
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

If we use MatTabGroup + MatTabs inside the MatMenu component, then in some cases the visibility hidden inline styling is not getting removed from the active tab. Refer steps or attached video for more details

https://github.com/angular/components/assets/92505353/7e512847-02ea-4d8b-9df8-f8da3cb1019a

Once the state has been reached, switching between more tabs can eventually 'fix' it, but only for that opening of the menu. Closing and reopening the menu can result in the issue reproducing again. A workaround, that is also demoed in the video, is to add custom styles, setting visibility to visible. Since the erroneous styling is applied inline, this workaround also requires the use of !important tag, which is fine for now, but not suitable as a permanent solution. 

I'm also attaching the link to a sample github project that I used in the video recording, for more info on how the code is structured. 

https://github.com/swapnil-verma-gl/angular-material-tabs

Addl note - While the project and the video use Angular Material v16, I can confirm that this issue is also present in at least angular v14, as that is what our actual project uses, and is where we first encountered this bug. 


### Reproduction

Stackblitz Link - https://stackblitz.com/edit/klkt9a-mfwvvv?file=package.json
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a component with a MatMenu and its trigger
2. Inside the MatMenu, add a MatTabGroup, with a couple of tabs
3. For each tab, add some content. This may be content directly inside the mat tab, or getting projected from another component
4. Now, open the menu and switch between some tabs
5. Close the menu
6. Repeat steps 4 and 5 repeatedly. Eventually, you will reach a state where the content for the active tab is not being shown. Refer video recording for more details

### Expected Behavior

Content for active tab is visible

### Actual Behavior

Content for active tab is hidden.

### Environment

- Angular: 14
- CDK/Material: 14
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Ubuntu
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(MatTabGroup): Visibility hidden mat-active-tab is not removed when MatTabGroup and MatTabs are used inside MatMenu" (#27426)

Issues.Title: fix(material/schematics): support all potential default builders for ng add
Issues.Body: With the advent of the developer preview for the esbuild-based browser application builder, there are now three potential "default" builders that could be present: browser, browser-esbuild, and application. To ensure that the material add schematics work with CLI generated projects moving forward, all of these potential builders are now checked when running the add schematics.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/schematics): support all potential default builders for ng add" (#27434)

Issues.Title: fix(material/autocomplete): blocking events to other overlays when there are no results
Issues.Body:
The autocomplete trigger attaches an overlay even if there are no options in the list. It also subscribes to keydown events and clicks while the panel is open which block events from reaching other overlays. This means that if the user focuses an autocomplete input with no options, the events from it won't reach other overlays.

These changes resolve the issue by subcribing and unsubscribing from the event streams depending on the visibility state of the panel.

Fixes #26479.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/autocomplete): blocking events to other overlays when there are no results" (#27432)

Issues.Title: bug(MatFormFieldModule): Label is outside the bounds of the form field
Issues.Body:
The label associated with a MatFormField is not positioned correctly.

**Case 1 - matPrefix**
As visible in the following image, the label is outside the bounds of the form field.

![1](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/25796932/62054bed-c052-41cd-89af-73feb2a8323f)

Inside `form-field.ts` - `_updateOutlineLabelOffset()` the HTML element is moved on the x-axis:
```ts
floatingLabel.style.transform = `var( --mat-mdc-form-field-label-transform, {FLOATING_LABEL_DEFAULT_DOCKED_TRANSFORM} translateX(${labelHorizontalOffset}))`;
```
> This is also visible in DevTools.
This transformation rule looks valid because it has a prefix icon. 
But in addition, if the element is moved on the x-axis, its width should be reduced by a value equal to the offset to fit the form field bounds.
```scss
width: calc(100% - calc(1 * (51.97072219848633px + var(--mat-mdc-form-field-label-offset-x, 0px))));
```
![2](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/25796932/929bfe46-1c53-458f-8ece-78a12350f8bd)

**Case 2 - matSuffix**
For `matSuffix` the fix would be easier, it should only update its width with the offset value.
 
![4](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/25796932/d941b793-7c2c-4b1f-b5ba-0e28ee21d49f)

**However** here it seems that the offset variable is missing from the scss file.
![var](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/25796932/75c39dac-07ff-457b-b8d6-78e52719d669)

Adding the CSS variable to the above file and updating the width should help with this issue.




### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/rudguk-yo1ggv?file=src%2Fexample%2Fform-field-appearance-example.html


### Expected Behavior

I expect the label to fit into the borders of the wrapping element.

### Actual Behavior

The label goes outside the borders of the wrapping element.

### Environment

- Angular: latest
- CDK/Material: latest
- Browser(s): Any
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Any
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatFormFieldModule): Label is outside the bounds of the form field" (#27431)
